medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive fatigue over the past 3 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 weeks ago with moderate fatigue and a mild headache that was worse in the morning but relieved with nonsteroidal antiinflammatory agents. Symptoms progressed to increased fatigue, forgetfulness, and confusion. The patient began sleeping most of the day and had difficulty completing usual tasks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia, seasonal allergies, hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Heavy tobacco use and lung cancer in father; melanoma in brother; no family history of hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife, works as a school principal, does not smoke or use illicit substances, consumes up to three glasses of wine each evening.
